column1: Two weeks had passed since graduation and our Motor Maids were just beginning to feel the results of their hard winter's work. It had been a tough pull to catch up with their classes after the return from Japan. There had been no gayeties for them during the Christmas holidays
column3: and for weeks afterwards Billie and Nancy and Elinor were tutored every afternoon. Mary Price
column4: the best student of the three
column6: and in the end had carried off first honors and a scholarship besides. But after the excitement of finals
column7: the four friends had collapsed like pricked balloons. Billie
column8: mortified at what she considered a weakness in her character
column9: had not been able to throw off a deep cold contracted in the spring. Mary Price was limp and white; Elinor had grown mortally thin
column10: and even Nancy had lost her roundness
column11: and her usually plump face was peaked and pale."My child needs mountain air!" said Mr. Campbell on one of his flying trips to West Haven. "She must not be in a hotel
column12: and she must have her friends with her."
